First Day of School.jpg?rnd=0.773602377517895","caption":"Pete Schwartzkopf, Jenny Nauman, Ernie Lopez, Bill Collick, and a Rehoboth Police Officer take a photo before students arrive for the first day of school.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Most at the Coast","src":"Most at the Coast Register-01.jpg?rnd=0.20898942565964","caption":"The 12th Annual Most at the Coast event will take place on November 9, 2019, from 8am - 4pm at Irish Eyes in Lewes. Click on the image for more information and to register for the event. Spring Mentor Breakfast","src":"RES Mentor Bfast.jpg?rnd=0.374234740796608","caption":"Mentors and volunteers at Rehoboth Elementary School, enjoyed a morning of treats at their annual spring get together. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"CHHS Field Day","src":"CHHS Field Day.jpg?rnd=0.892437640527467","caption":"Students at CHHS participated in a Field Day full of activities including flag football, volleyball, tug of war, soccer and a dunk tank!","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"2020 District Teacher of the Year","src":"2020 District TOY.jpg?rnd=0.170274897557811","caption":"On April 29, Brennan Clarke was named the 2020 District Teacher of the Year! Congrats Mr. Clarke!","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"CHHS Students Attend DECA Awards","src":"DECA Students.jpg?rnd=0.0216552275333811","caption":"31 students attended the Statewide DECA Awards Ceremony. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"HOB Bots at the Beach","src":"HOB Robotics.jpg?rnd=0.403815509473819","caption":"H.O.B students hosted students from throughout the area in a VEX Robotics competition. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"RES Fall Festival","src":"RES Fall Festival.jpg?rnd=0.408874587346276","caption":"Rehoboth Elementary students enjoy the photobooth at the PBS Fall Festival hosted by the school PTO.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"BMS Student of the Week Celebration","src":"BMS Student of the Week Celebration.jpg?rnd=0.512432185240291","caption":"Beacon hosted an afternoon celebration for the students who were previously recognized as Student of the Week. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Love Creek Merit Award","src":"LCE Architect Award.jpg?rnd=0.357078944033514","caption":"Love Creek Elementary was awarded the 2018 AIA Delaware Design Award in recognition of design excellence. Love Creek was designed by a team of architects at Tetra Tech. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"MES Holds PBS Dance Party","src":"MES Dance Party.jpg?rnd=0.941885027076064","caption":"Students recharged their batteries at the start of the new year with a refresh of the school rules and a dance party!","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Shields Third Grade Research Lab","src":"Third Grade Research Lab.jpg?rnd=0.665948505823476","caption":"Shields Elementary third-graders hosted family and friends at their weather unit research lab presentations.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Rehoboth Elementary Beam Signing","src":"2018 Beam Signing.jpg?rnd=0.425397464272286","caption":"On November 8, Board Members and Administrators gathered for the ceremonial Beam Signing of the new Rehoboth Elementary School","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"H.O. Brittingham Ribbon Cutting","src":"Ribbon Cutting Ceremony.jpg?rnd=0.600325686670991","caption":"The new H.O. Brittingham Elementary officially opened its doors in August and welcomed students in September!","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"All Smiles","src":"All Smiles.jpg?rnd=0.138408495177705","caption":"Students, staff and family members give big smiles during the Blockhouse Pond Walk!","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"2018 National ProStart Student Invitational","src":"2018 National ProStart Student Invitational.jpg?rnd=0.267900601154147","caption":"Two Cape students visited Legislative Hall earlier this week to receive kudos for their efforts in the 2018 National ProStart Student Invitational.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"AVID School-wide Site of Distinction","src":"AVID Site of Distinction.jpg?rnd=0.23875296825485","caption":"Mariner Middle School was named an AVID Site of Distinction by the AVID Center, which is the highest rating a school can achieve.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"#CapeProud","src":"CapeProud.jpg?rnd=0.773017048264396","caption":"Staff lining up on the football field to show that they're #CapeProud.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"}]}}

div.h1: Cape Henlopen School District in the News

img.alt: Milton Elementary second-grader Jude Kimmel is painting positive signs to cheer local workers.

a.span: Father, Son Paint Messages of Hope, Humor

div.p: Dan and Jude Kimmel honor area workers.

a.title: Go to comments for Father, Son Paint Messages of Hope, Humor

img.alt: Lindsey Reynolds uses the wifi in the CHHS parking lot to access her schoolwork.

a.span: Student Wi-Fi Hotspots Available at Cape Schools

div.p: Free internet access for remote learning

a.title: Go to comments for Student Wi-Fi Hotspots Available at Cape Schools

img.alt: CHSD District Office

div.p: Graduation set for June 9; last student day June 12

a.title: Go to comments for Cape School Board Adjusts 2019-20 Calendar

img.alt: The Minto Family rock's their socks for World Down Syndrome Day

a.span: Cape Community Rocks Socks for World Down Syndrome Day

div.p: Despite the school closure in effect, students and staff throughout the Cape Henlopen School District celebrated World Down Syndrome Days Rock Your Socks, by doing so virtually.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Community Rocks Socks for World Down Syndrome Day

img.alt: Steve Rayburn, Lewes Weis Market manager, loads bags up with a loaf of bread.

a.span: Weis in Lewes Helps Cape District Feed Kids

div.p: Lewes Weis Markets brought 100 bags of food for families to H.O. Brittingham Elementary School for distribution April 9.

a.title: Go to comments for Weis in Lewes Helps Cape District Feed Kids

img.alt: Minority leadership conference attendees from the Cape Henlopen School District.

a.span: Cape Educators Attend Minority Leadership Conference

div.p: Members of the Ethnic Minority Affairs Committee from the Cape Henlopen School District attended the Delaware State Education Associations 10th Annual Minority Leadership Conference Feb. 29.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Educators Attend Minority Leadership Conference

img.alt: Cape High junior Sydney Doel at the Sussex County Science Fair.

a.span: Local Students Shine at Sussex County Science Fair

div.p: One Cape High School student and two Beacon students show case their research and inventions at annual competition

a.title: Go to comments for Local Students Shine at Sussex County Science Fair

img.alt: The $44 million state-funded Sussex Consortium is set to Monday, March 16.

div.p: The Sussex Consortium is set to open to students Monday, March 16.

a.title: Go to comments for Sussex Consortium to Open March 16

img.alt: Cape Superintendent Bob Fulton outlined the need for a tax increase.

a.span: Cape District Holds First Referendum Community Meeting

div.p: Operating expenses require tax increase.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape District Holds First Referendum Community Meeting

img.alt: Claire Layton and Lynn Wheeler Moore

a.span: Former Teachers, Students Claim Bricks from Rehoboth School

div.p: Memories, tears shed at site of beloved lakeside school

a.title: Go to comments for Former Teachers, Students Claim Bricks from Rehoboth School

img.alt: Delaware students pose for a group photo at the World Finals at Michigan State University.

a.span: Cape Odyssey of the Mind Shoe Drive Runs Through March 26

div.p: In an effort to raise funds for upcoming tournaments and travel expenses, Cape Henlopen School Districts Odyssey of the Mind program is conducting a shoe drive fundraiser through Thursday, March 26.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Odyssey of the Mind Shoe Drive Runs Through March 26

img.alt: Shown in this graph, Capes test scores are consistently above state averages.

a.span: Growth, Reduced State Funding Drive March 31 Referendum

div.p: Cape Superintendent Presents Case for Tax Increase

a.title: Go to comments for Growth, Reduced State Funding Drive March 31 Referendum

img.alt: Superintendent Bob Fulton detailed accomplishments and challenges of the district.

a.span: Cape Henlopen Officials Celebrate 50 years as a School District

div.p: State of the district event highlights history, accomplishments, challenges.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Henlopen Officials Celebrate 50 years as a School District

img.alt: Cape community caring volunteers helped organize the gifts at The Crossing.

a.span: Community Caring Event Provides Gifts for 300 Local Kids

div.p: For the last several years, Cape Henlopen School District homeless liaisons have coordinated a community caring event around the holidays.

a.title: Go to comments for Community Caring Event Provides Gifts for 300 Local Kids

img.alt: Visitors and staff gather in the cafeteria to participate in the gallery walk.

a.span: Cape Henlopen School District Holds Its First "State of the District"

div.p: On Thursday, January 30, the Cape Henlopen School District held its first ever "State of the District."

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Henlopen School District Holds Its First "State of the District"

img.alt: Carlyn Parsley and son Reed Parsley

div.p: Pre-K Parent Academy provides early exposure to school

a.title: Go to comments for Program Readies Children for Kindergarten

img.alt: Cape High Assistant Principal Kyle Bentley was named 2020 Assistant Principal of the Year.

a.span: Assistant Principal Kyle Bentley Earns Statewide Recognition

div.p: Cape High administrator now vies for national honor.

a.title: Go to comments for Assistant Principal Kyle Bentley Earns Statewide Recognition

img.alt: The site of the old Rehoboth Public School is now rubble.

a.span: Demolition Complete at Rehoboth; Milton Demo Underway

div.p: Demolition is complete at Rehoboth Elementary and underway at Milton Elementary, while construction nears completion at Sussex Consortium, now set to open in March.

a.title: Go to comments for Demolition Complete at Rehoboth; Milton Demo Underway

img.alt: Rehoboth Elementary received national recognition for gains in bridging the achievement gap.

a.span: Rehoboth Elementary Nationally Recognized for Bridging Achievement Gap

div.p: Beacon Middle; Love Creek, Milton elementaries earn state recognition

a.title: Go to comments for Rehoboth Elementary Nationally Recognized for Bridging Achievement Gap

img.alt: Cape teachers and board members visit West Rehoboth.

a.span: Cape Teachers Visit Communities, Build Relationships

div.p: Goal to show support, raise minority student test scores

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Teachers Visit Communities, Build Relationships

img.alt: Cape Henlopen High School

a.span: Cape Henlopen High School Breaks Ground on Expansion

div.p: Cape Henlopen High School is expanding once again and this time with a new 400 student addition to their campus. School officials, state and county legislators and others broke ground on a $16 million expansion.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Henlopen High School Breaks Ground on Expansion

img.alt: Breaking through the banner at the Cape football game is Davey Frederick.

a.span: Cape Schools Focus on Inclusion of all Students

div.p: The Sussex Consortium, Cape Henlopen High School and Milton Elementary School students and staff recently joined forces to keep inclusion of all students at the front of their minds.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Schools Focus on Inclusion of all Students

img.alt: Cape Henlopen School Board members.

a.span: School Board Email Newsletter Keeps Readers Up-to-Date

div.p: Parents, staff, community can sign up for Board E-Report

a.title: Go to comments for School Board Email Newsletter Keeps Readers Up-to-Date

img.alt: The sophomore float Storm the Seahawks took top honors in the float contest.

div.p: The Cape Henlopen High School homecoming parade travelled from Lewes Beach to Legends Stadium Oct. 5. The halftime show highlighted the homecoming court.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Celebrates Homecoming Festivities

img.alt: Michael Varhola, Carol King, and David McDowell

a.span: Solar Lanterns Donated to Cape Henlopen School District Program

div.p: Michael Varhola, owner of Solar Empowerment Initiative in Silver Spring, Md., recently donated solar lanterns to the Cape Henlopen School District through the Village Improvement Association.

a.title: Go to comments for Solar Lanterns Donated to Cape Henlopen School District Program

img.alt: With 5,861 students, Cape Henlopen schools welcomed 200 more students this year.

a.span: Growth Trend Continues in Cape district

div.p: Annual unit count determines funding, staffing

a.title: Go to comments for Growth Trend Continues in Cape district

img.alt: Brennan Clarke of Shields Elementary was named the district teacher of the year.

a.span: Delaware Teacher of the Year to be Named Oct. 15

div.p: Cape districts Brennan Clarke vying for top honor.

a.title: Go to comments for Delaware Teacher of the Year to be Named Oct. 15

img.alt: Students and staff Accepting the Special Olympics Delaware Unified Champion Banner.

a.span: Cape High Honored for Commitment to Inclusion

div.p: School named a Special Olympics Delaware Unified Champion.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape High Honored for Commitment to Inclusion

img.alt: Kristine Wood, Jacquie Kisiel, Caran Lamb and Gail Mack volunteer with the Bookmobile.

a.span: Browseabout Books Donates to Cape Bookmobile

div.p: For the seventh summer, the Cape Henlopen Bookmobile made its rounds throughout the district delivering books to students.

a.title: Go to comments for Browseabout Books Donates to Cape Bookmobile

img.alt: Local historian Hazel Brittingham.

a.span: Cape Henlopen School District Turned 50 This Year

div.p: Local historian Hazel Brittingham recounts the history of Cape Henlopen School District.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Henlopen School District Turned 50 This Year

img.alt: Chad Harmon, School Resource Officer at Cape Henlopen School District.

a.span: New Resource Officer at Cape High

div.p: Harmon seeks to mentor, build relationships with students.

a.title: Go to comments for New Resource Officer at Cape High

img.alt: In addition to required core classes, all Cape High students choose a career pathway.

div.p: Career and technical programs prepare students for college, workforce.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Students Explore Demand-Driven Occupations

img.alt: Masons laid the cornerstone for the Rehoboth Public School in 1939. Classes began in 1941.

a.span: Facing Demolition, Rehoboth Public School Yielding Legacy Items

div.p: Rehoboth Public School has a date with a wrecking crew before the year is out. In the decades that have passed since masons mortared its 1939 cornerstone into place, thousands of young people have been educated in its classrooms.

a.title: Go to comments for Facing Demolition, Rehoboth Public School Yielding Legacy Items

img.alt: Shields Elementary first-graders Oliver Melson, left, and Ryan Mears share a book before school.

div.p: More than 5,600 students start school year in Cape Henlopen School District.

a.title: Go to comments for First Day Faces

img.alt: SC teacher Lacey Brown was elected president of the Cape Henlopen Education Association

a.span: New Leadership at Cape Teachers Union

div.p: Consortium teacher Lacey Brown elected president of CHEA.

a.title: Go to comments for New Leadership at Cape Teachers Union

img.alt: Ron Gray, Gail Stenger, and Scott Walsmith stand in front of their old high school.

a.span: Rehoboth Alum: True to their School

div.p: Rehoboth High School Alum have fond memories of their time in the building.

a.title: Go to comments for Rehoboth Alum: True to their School

img.alt: Rehoboth Elementary Opens its Doors

div.p: Students, parents tour new school

a.title: Go to comments for Rehoboth Elementary Opens its Doors

img.alt: CHEF Board Members help to distribute supplies to staff.

div.p: Caravan of Caring visits all Cape schools

a.title: Go to comments for CHEF distributes donated school supplies

img.alt: Cape School District, District Office

a.span: Cape Revises Student Code of Conduct

div.p: Restorative practices replace conventional discipline.

a.title: Go to comments for Cape Revises Student Code of Conduct

img.alt: Dr. Jeff Conrad, Supervisor of Special Education at CHSD.

a.span: Jeff Conrad Named Special Education Coordinator of the Year

div.p: Cape administrator works to help all students reach potential.

a.title: Go to comments for Jeff Conrad Named Special Education Coordinator of the Year

img.alt: Jennifer Edwards, Natashe Mullen, Shanett Hynson, and Richelle Clark

a.span: Summer Program Empowers Middle School Students

div.p: Cooking, sewing, fitness activities build confidence.

a.title: Go to comments for Summer Program Empowers Middle School Students

img.alt: Dr. Alison Myers presents Mr. Bill Collick with the oath of office for the Board of Education.

div.p: Myers elected president; Bradley, vice president

a.title: Go to comments for Cape School Board Members Sworn-In

p.br: Excellence, Equity and Responsiveness: Every Student, Every Classroom, Every Day!

span.p:
Our Mission:
The Cape Henlopen School District celebrates the diversity of our students, staff, and community. We cultivate compassionate and innovative thinkers by providing every student with a welcoming, safe, equitable school community that is affirming and inclusive. Cape Henlopen engages and challenges ALL students by providing a responsive educational experience to prepare for post-secondary education and/or career opportunities.

We will be pushing out additional information later today. Please keep an eye on our social media page and website!

span.strong: Please see the below announcement from DIAA regarding the State Championship Basketball Tournament:

span.p: DIAA ANNOUNCES BASKETBALL TOURNAMENT CHANGES

The Delaware Interscholastic Athletic Association Board of Directors voted today to approve modifications to the DIAA State Basketball Championships as a precautionary measure in response to the national rise in Coronavirus cases.

The Boys and Girls State Basketball semi-finals scheduled for tonight have been postponed to allow time for the host sites to make the necessary adjustments. All semi-final games have been moved to Friday. Times will be announced after consultation with each sport committee.
The Unified championship will be Friday at Caesar Rodney High School. The game time will be announced once details are finalized.
The Boys and Girls Championships still are scheduled to be played on Saturday, March 14.
All games will be played with the following modifications, as approved by the DIAA Board:
All games will be played at the higher seed school.
Only the following individuals will be allowed into the contest:

ul.li: Participating teams limited to the official party of 22 as detailed in the DIAA Winter Tournament Manual*
Up to 2 parents or legal guardians of each participating player

span.p: *As defined in the manual: The Official School Party cannot exceed 22 people and is defined as players, coaches, managers, scorers/statisticians, trainer, and administrators.
School athletic directors will be contacted to provide a list of parents/legal guardians and instructions for those individuals to obtain tickets to the event.There is no cost for these tickets.
All games will be livestreamed at https://www.nfhsnetwork.com/. A monthly pass costs $10.99 and would allow one to watch both the semi-final and championships games.

p.strong: Ticket refunds for Bob Carpenter Center

span.p: For those who already bought tickets through a school, contact the school for a refund. If purchased online from the University of Delaware site by credit card a refund will be issued to the card account by UD within 3 to 5 business days. UD is contacting those who paid by cash or check to issue refunds.

p.strong: Ticket refunds for High School Sites

span.p: For those who already purchased pre-sale tickets through a school, contact the school for a refund.
Members of the media will not be eligible to attend and will be provided a link to watch the contests online.

p.em: The Coronavirus impact on school communities continues to be fluid. Please be alert for additional modifications. For the latest Delaware Coronavirus news and resources, see the Delaware Division of Public Healths website (

span.p: For more information regarding DIAA Championships, visit DIAA or follow DIAA on Twitter (@DIAA_Delaware); Instagram (diaa_de) and Facebook (DelawareInterscholasticAthleticAssociation) for the latest updates. For more information, email diaa@doe.k12.de.us.

a.title: Go to comments for March 12, 2020 Update: 12:29PM

p.span: A letter and a Pandemic PreparednessAction Plan went home with students today. Hereare links to the letter and the action plan.

a.title: Go to comments for March 11, 2020 Update: 6:00PM

span.p: Osher Lifelong Learning Institute (Lewes Campus Update) Given theCenters for Disease Control's guidance for older adultsand those with chronic health conditions, all programming forOLLI(whose membership is exclusively age 50 and older) has been suspended effective immediately until further notice.

a.title: Go to comments for March 11, 2020 Update: 9:36AM

p.strong: Cape Henlopen School District Health Advisory Regarding the Coronavirus and Influenza

span.p: The Delaware Division of Public Health (DPH) is closely monitoring the coronavirus disease and has provided school districts with cautionary guidelines.
Please keep in mind that there are no confirmed cases in the Cape Henlopen School District or the state of Delaware. We do, however, want to be proactive to keep students and staff safe.
The best precautions to take are the ones always recommended for avoiding colds and flu.
We ask that everyone in Cape Henlopen consider the following advice:

ul.li: Stay home if you are sick and avoid healthy people. Do not send children to school if they have above-normal temperatures.

Follow good hygiene protocols
cover nose and mouth with your sleeve while coughing or sneezing
wash hands frequently with soap and water or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer
avoid touching eyes, nose, or mouth
avoid others who are sick

span.p: Staff will also assist by regularly cleaning and disinfecting frequently touched objects and surfaces in classrooms, offices, restrooms, and hallways.
We ask parents to advise your childs school nurse in advance of international travel. In addition to following the above-mentioned precautions, DPH highly recommends getting an influenza shot.
Anyone with concerns should contact their healthcare provider.
Visit https://dhss.delaware.gov/dhss/dph/index.html for more information regarding Delawares response and plans.

a.title: Go to comments for March 3, 2020 Update

a.span: What are the school start and end times?
